subject: PEL: Error support for VPD
commitMessage:
PEL: Error support for VPD

This commit takes care of logging predictive error in case of
any vpd file has invalid data/no data.
If FRU is present on the system and due to any reason vpd
collection fails, then there should be a non-informational
PEL to indicate there is a vpd issue.

Test: Tested for an empty vpd file-

./ibm-read-vpd  -f /tmp/empty.vpd
        "0x500011DF": {
        "SRC":                  "BD554001",
        "Message":              "A VPD data exception occurred.",
        "PLID":                 "0x500011DF",
        "CreatorID":            "BMC",
        "Subsystem":            "CEC Hardware - VPD Interface",
        "Commit Time":          "12/22/2021 04:20:05",
        "Sev":                  "Predictive Error",
        "CompID":               "0x4000"
    }

Change-Id: I4fe119b580b555bb1bc47bf1f714bac4fb7e2b55
Signed-off-by: Alpana Kumari <alpankum@in.ibm.com>

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 5cb3b1f361d347c7881d546241c4bb214d246da2

Please change the severity to Predictive.
Please add a callout (by inventory path) since every predictive PEL must have a callout.
Please remove this and read the HW keyword off of the planar. DD level of the processor does not tell us about the planar pass.
Please remove and revert to what we had before.

I know I can make use of readBusProperty(), which I did. but it's returning me empty string (it returns everything in form of string)
after doing it here, it worked fine.
Why is this DD level checking code still here?
please mention the PCIE device and PASS 1 planar override
We should be ignoring the MSB - If you recall, we did the same when setting the right dev tree too.
Why are you handling just this very specific case of empty VPD file?
All other cases are logging PEL as part of catch
Those cases need to be handled too. AT least in one case, I saw a non IBM pcie card show up with all FF's in its VPD.

Yes, I have seen that all FF vpd data so many times.
Will that not be handled as part of line- 1400-1406??
Where is this function getting file from? Did this even compile?

master compilation fails for vpd-manager common error so I either compile it in 1020 OR Gerrit CI. This time I left it for CI.

Yeah, need to fix this.
What does this do? This is basically 0
yes. I want all 0s in MSB
You'll get that anyway by just doing if(hwVersion[1] < 2). The two line above that if are unnecessary.
This whole section can be avoided if it is not a pcie device, please do so.
Please remove this. We had this print earlier and it'd cause a bunch of journal thrashing.
can you give a doxygen for this method to understand the purpose of it.

I am not 100% sure, still would like to know,
what if the call is made from line 1440 and an exception is thrown by call method? Will that be caught in the next catch block or will it go uncaught and that is what we are expecting?

I'm also not very sure, but I think it will get caught in next exception as it is generic exception.
Will look more and confirm.
Hmm, in that case do you want to dump vpdvector in case there is bus failure?
okay . line 1459 won't be handling that?
Yes, that is what I wanted to know.That in case of bus failure do we need to dump the vpd vector in this case as well.
I thinks it's okay to have basic data, in case of any failure.

Suggestion: "call" methohd will throw in all cases. So we can get rid of this check?

https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-virtual-sensor/+/38244
this returns true if the pcie is on pass 1 planar. but your cout statement is contradicting

okay. Not contradicting but need to make it clear.
This cout is to say- PCIE_device vpd is not valid on PASS1 planar, so No action will be taken.
Not sure on severity, if discussed already then no issues, else please check
yes. we need to have this as WARNING
same here. your cout statement is contradicting with the condition

this condition checks for it the service running for one of the PCIE_device on PASS1 planar.
IF that is the case, we can't do anything. vpd would be all ffffs.
So this msg says that and returns.
ok. understood. Please include this in the api's (isThisPcieOnPass1planar()) doxygen - answering why we need this api.
Please add details on what *this* commit is doing and why.
Suggestion: If we are putting comments about functions, better put it doxygen way. It looks neat and easy to read.
yes. can you give a better doxygen by adding what HW keyword actually describes and why this method is required.
you can make this a static function if its used only within this file.

right.
All the functions defined in this file are being used only inside this file. And so all of them should be defined as static.
But I see some are Not. 
we need to check that every time a new function being added to this file.
I think there are constexprs for some of these

Only xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Manager is defined twice.(in meson_options.txt  and const.hpp)

But not defined for -
"/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/chassis/motherboard"(used at 3 places)
and  "org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties" (used at 7 places)

Shall I define them newly with this commit?
No, I think we can do that later
Can an empty file simply be handled as a VpdDataException from the parser? That would mean that the code here is not repeated.

I tried to catch it only one place as part of VpdDataException.

Yes, for empty file it was thrown and caught in this section.
But dumpBadVpd throwing another exception for that empty file-
=============================================================
 ./ibm-read-vpd  -f /tmp/empty_vpd 
DBG: catch1
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::runtime_error'
  what():  Failed to open bad vpd file path in /tmp/bad-vpd. Unable to dump the broken/bad vpd file.
==============================================================
Instead without dumpBadVpd it works fine.

This is the only difference between these 2 handling.
That is probably another bug that needs to be fixed. But please remove this code that explicitly checks for an empty file.
rc = 0 should take care of this.
could you try to get the oxygen correct. I do not see the parameters in and return mentioned.

I heard in cpp file we just need some description, and not complete doxygen.
we have so many functions like this, like just above function - line 326
yes, it is vpd eeprom file path.
